maml:description.maml:para: Returns one or several ConfigMgr objects. Results can be limited by a Filter.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the ConfigMgr WMI provider Class Name
Specifies the Where clause to filter the specified ConfigMgr WMI provider class. If no filter is supplied, all objects will be returned.
Specifies if the lazy properties shall be fetched as well. On default, lazy properties won't be included in the result.
Specifies the ConfigMgr WMI provider Class Name
Specifies the Where clause to filter the specified ConfigMgr WMI provider class. If no filter is supplied, all objects will be returned.
Specifies if the lazy properties shall be fetched as well. On default, lazy properties won't be included in the result.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns a list of ConfigMgr packages.
Returns a ConfigMgr Package with PackageID 'TST00001'.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the PackageID
Specifies the Folder ID
Specifies the Package Type
Specifies the Package Name If Search is set, the name can include the default WQL placeholders [],^,% and _
Specifies if Name contains a search string
Specifies the Folder ID
Specifies the Package Type
Specifies the Folder ID
Specifies the CIID of assigned content.
Specifies the Package Type
Specifies the Folder ID
Specifies a custom filter to use
Specifies the PackageID

Specifies the Folder ID
Specifies the CIID of assigned content.
Specifies the Package Type
Specifies a custom filter to use

Specifies the Affinity Source

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the ConfigMgr package with PackageID 'TST00001'.
$Pkg | Remove-CMInstance Removes the ConfigMgr package with PackageID 'TST00001'.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the ConfigMgr Provider Server name. If no value is specified, the script assumes to be executed on the Site Server.
Specifies the ConfigMgr provider Site Code. If no value is specified, the script will evaluate it from the Site Server.
Specifies the Credentials to connect to the Provider Server.
Specifies the ConfigMgr Provider Server name. If no value is specified, the script assumes to be executed on the Site Server.
Specifies the ConfigMgr provider Site Code. If no value is specified, the script will evaluate it from the Site Server.
Specifies the Credentials to connect to the Provider Server.
Specifies the ConfigMgr WMI provider Class Name
Specifies the properties to be supplied to the new object
Specifies if the new instance shall be created on the client only. Will be used for embedded classes without key property
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the ConfigMgr WMI provider Class Name
Specifies the properties to be supplied to the new object
Specifies if the new instance shall be created on the client only. Will be used for embedded classes without key property

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new User device affinity
The New-CMUserDeviceAffinity cmdlet creates a new user device affinity.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the DeviceID (ResourceID)
Specifies the User name e.g. "{Domain}\{samaccountname}
Specifies the Package Type
Specifies if the Type property should be set for the relationship

dev:remarks.maml:para: $Pkg | Set-CMInstance -Properties @{Description = "Update Me"} Updates the Description of the specified ConfigMgr package.
Updates the Description of the specified ConfigMgr package.

maml:description.maml:para: Write-Log writes a message to a specified log file with the current time stamp. Test
The Write-Log function is designed to add logging capability to other scripts. In addition to writing output and/or verbose you can write to a log file for later debugging.

maml:Description.maml:para: Defines the content that should be added to the log file.

The path to the log file to which the Message shall be written. Path and file will be created if it does not exist. If omitted function will use the $LogPath variable defined on script or global level. If that isn't set as well, function will fail
Defines the criticality of the log information being written to the log. Can be any of Error, Warning, Informational Default is Info
Defines if the Message should be passed through the pipeline. Severity will be mapped to the corresponding Write-Verbose, Write-Warning or Write-Error functions
Defines if the message should be written as plain text message. On default, System Center Configuration Manager log format is used.
Defines the content that should be added to the log file.

The path to the log file to which the Message shall be written. Path and file will be created if it does not exist. If omitted function will use the $LogPath variable defined on script or global level. If that isn't set as well, function will fail
Defines the criticality of the log information being written to the log. Can be any of Error, Warning, Informational Default is Info
Defines if the Message should be passed through the pipeline. Severity will be mapped to the corresponding Write-Verbose, Write-Warning or Write-Error functions
Defines if the message should be written as plain text message. On default, System Center Configuration Manager log format is used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Writes the content to the specified log file and creates the path and file specified.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Write-Log -Message 'Folder does not exist.' -Path c:\Logs\Script.log -Level Error

dev:remarks.maml:para: Writes the message to the specified log file as an error message, and writes the message to the error pipeline.
